def: The act of compressing, or state of being compressed."Compression of thought." Johnson.
A large ship, esp. a merchant vessel of the largest size.Where your argosies with portly sail . . . Do overpeer the pettytraffickers. Shak.
The operation of removing one or both of the ovaries;oöphorectomy.
The black currant; also, the wild plum. [Prov. Eng.]
Full of truth; veracious; reliable.-- Truth"ful*ly, adv.-- Truth"ful*ness, n.
The concluding part of an oration; especially, a final summingup and enforcement of an argument. Burke.
Of or pertaining to the Thysanura.
To play the duke. [Poetic]Lord Angelo dukes it well in his absence. Shak.
Any fish of the family Silurid or of the order Siluroidei.
1. (Zoöl.) An amphibious animal of the genus Rana and relatedgenera, of many species. Frogs swim rapidly, and take long leaps onland. Many of the species utter loud notes in the springtime.
